description: From Middle English forpinen, equivalent to for- +‎ pine. Cognate with Middle Low German vorpinen (“to forpine”).

verbs.description: forpine (third-person singular simple present forpines, present participle forpining, simple past and past participle forpined)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To waste away through suffering or through torment.
examples: […]  While to my sight thy giant stature rearsIts bulk forpined upon these savage rocksIn shameful bonds the linked adamant locks.
